citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The written program of veterinary care record for the facility was not available for review at the time of inspection. The
facility's written program of veterinary care record is necessary to assess compliance with the regulations and standards,
thus helping to ensure proper veterinary care and animal welfare. Ensure the written program of veterinary care and all
required records are available for review by APHIS officials at the time of inspection. Correct by: 25 September 2023.

The facility has an assortment of excess stored equipment taking up a portion of the bird housing area next to the bird
primary enclosure and there is an excessive amount of accumulation of spilled feed outside of the bird primary enclosure
at the base. Equipment stored in animal areas could accumulate dust and dirt and act as hiding places for vermin, spilled
feed could attract pests and vermin. Animal and food storage areas inside of housing facilities must be kept neat and free
of excess equipment and spilled feed to ensure the animal area is maintained free of pests and vermin that may
contaminate feed and affect the overall health and well-being of the birds. Eliminate the excess equipment and
accumulation of feed and maintain a neat and free from clutter bird housing area. Correct by: 25 September 2023.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
An environmental enhancement plan approved by the attending veterinarian that documents the appropriate provisions to
provide enrichment and special considerations for birds has not been established by the facility. Failure to establish and
maintain an environmental enhancement plan can result in birds not receiving adequate enrichment which can lead to
behavioral, social, health, and other psychological problems. Establish, maintain and follow an environment enhancement
plan approved by the attending veterinarian to promote the psychological well-being of the birds. Correct by: 2 October
2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with President.
End of report.
n

narrative:
2.126(a) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
The written program of veterinary care record for the facility was not available for review at the time of inspection. The 
facility's written program of veterinary care record is necessary to assess compliance with the regulations and standards, 
thus helping to ensure proper veterinary care and animal welfare. Ensure the written program of veterinary care and all 
required records are available for review by APHIS officials at the time of inspection. Correct by: 25 September 2023. 
3.150(b) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The facility has an assortment of excess stored equipment taking up a portion of the bird housing area next to the bird 
primary enclosure and there is an excessive amount of accumulation of spilled feed outside of the bird primary enclosure 
at the base. Equipment stored in animal areas could accumulate dust and dirt and act as hiding places for vermin, spilled 
feed could attract pests and vermin. Animal and food storage areas inside of housing facilities must be kept neat and free 
of excess equipment and spilled feed to ensure the animal area is maintained free of pests and vermin that may 
contaminate feed and affect the overall health and well-being of the birds. Eliminate the excess equipment and 
accumulation of feed and maintain a neat and free from clutter bird housing area. Correct by: 25 September 2023. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
An environmental enhancement plan approved by the attending veterinarian that documents the appropriate provisions to 
provide enrichment and special considerations for birds has not been established by the facility. Failure to establish and 
maintain an environmental enhancement plan can result in birds not receiving adequate enrichment which can lead to 
behavioral, social, health, and other psychological problems. Establish, maintain and follow an environment enhancement 
plan approved by the attending veterinarian to promote the psychological well-being of the birds. Correct by: 2 October 
2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with President. 
 
End of report.

n
